channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2023100220
item.description:
Report X-2023100220

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-23
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100220 SequenceEvent: Package was dropped causing the lids to come off and for leakage to happen. Package was put into a lined tote and spill pads were used to clean up leaked product. DescribePack: Caps came off due to package being dropped. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Caps were put back on and tightened and package was kept in an upright position. 2. X-2023100222 SequenceEvent: Package was found on dock leaking, package was put into a lined tote and spill pads were used to clean up leaked product. DescribePack: Cap had come loose during transit causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightend.

item.title: Report X-2023100218
item.description:
Report X-2023100218

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-23
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager called QA about a leaking hazmat, when QA arrived the found the hazmat only had a wet spot on it. Package was put into a lined tote and taken to the hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: When package was inspected it was discovered that one of the bottles had a loose cap that caused the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was kept in an upright position and cap was tightened

item.title: Report X-2023100217
item.description:
Report X-2023100217

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-23
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by manager leaking on dock, manager called QA, QA put package into a lined tote. No actual product leaked onto the floor of dock, so no clean up was necessary. Wet spot was seen on top of package. DescribePack: When package was inspected it was discovered that one bottle of product had a loose cap that cause the wet spot on the top of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was kept in an upright position in a lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023100168
item.description:
Report X-2023100168

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-31T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: GEORGETOWN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered at unload leaking. Package was placed in a storage bin and taken to QA for inspection. Upon inspection it was noticed that one of the two containers had its lid fall off and all of the contents leaked out. Remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and packed with package materials to prevent shift during transit, scanned as a code 39, 105 & 99 and marked for disposal at the hub. Awaiting disposition from PGH. DescribePack: one of two bottles had no lid and leaked out its contents DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Better handling techniques

item.title: Report X-2023100150
item.description:
Report X-2023100150

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-31T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap was loose. A package handler moved the box causing it to leak. We cleaned up the spill with neutralizer. We secured the hazmat and soiled clean-up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap was loose causing a leak DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023100115
item.description:
Report X-2023100115

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to a leaking bucket, once QA arrived they found out it was a leaking hazmat. Spill pads were used to clean up leaked product, plastic pail was put into a lined tote. DescribePack: When plastic pail was inspected it was found that the bottom was punctured by a sharp object when it was sat down forcefully. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Plastic pail was sat in an upside down position with hole upwards in a lined tote to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023091054
item.description:
Report X-2023091054

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler dropped the package and QA was called. We cleaned up the spill with absorbent pads. We secured the package and clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Glass bottle shattered after being dropped DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote.
